message: Enthusiastic +1 for Graham's question. I would love to see this kind of feedback from users of those types of services too.

I would dearly like to see the likes of people running new style hosting such as ep.io, gondor.io, etc, give feedback on what they really want to see in WSGI hosting mechanisms. Apache/mod_wsgi is not designed for that space and most thus use gunicorn but is that even a good solution and can things be made better. Is there a market for purpose built WSGI hosting mechanism for mass deployment?
JKM and I (and the folks from Opscode) have been planning a Chef open space/drinkup, so that shall also happen :-)
There's also the ever-present Python 3 question; we (ep.io) would love to offer python 3 support (and PyPy, but that's easier), but the stack there isn't quite mature enough yet.
Still, I'm definitely +1 on an open space.

With my day job hat on, the other thing I want to do at PyCon is talk to you guys from the likes of gondor.io, ep.io etc, about working together down the track on getting you to provide built in support for the Python agent I am working on for the NewRelic RPM production web application monitoring system.
@GrahamDumpleton would be happy to talk about adding support on DjangoZoom for the NewRelic Python agent. Let's talk at PyCon!
@andrewgodwin Can you email/tweet me your email so got direct contact details for someone at ep.io.
@GrahamDumpleton If you want just me, use andrew@ep.io (I'm not worried about making that address public, it's not exactly unguessable)
Okay, I scheduled an open space session for tomorrow (saturday) at 6pm in Hannover F. Add your name at http://bit.ly/pydeploy.
